7.12.23  3:17 am   Whenever I write music, I always find myself writing pretty much the same part over and over for each part of the song. While this sounds okay, it feels empty and I'd like my music to have some more "depth" How would you suggest I fix this?

      the best suggestion i have for this is try to deliberately make part of the song terrible. the route back is usually new and great. but it only works if you were genuinely trying to ruin it first

7.11.23  6:42 pm   Can you teach me music theory? (please) 

      understanding and analyzing music is a lot like understanding and analyzing beautiful pictures. both people need to at least be looking at the same picture, and try to analyze it first in their own way, then they can compare analyses. so i think what you'd have to do first is try some stuff first (anything), then tell me what you notice. then we can discuss different things we've noticed

7.11.23  6:29 pm   When you read these words, is there a feeling of subject-object dualism that appears?

     no, although i can identify the subjects and objects if i think about it for a moment (and i assume you are talking about grammar)

      Or is the inherent openness of consciousness readily experienced?

      your second clause didn't inherently strike me as a direct opposite to the first, so i'll have to approach it separately. in general, consciousness seems not as open as it probably ought to be

7.11.23  1:30 pm   If a square is a rectangle, but a rectangle not a square, and a circle is an oval, but a circle not an oval, is a triangle a triangle, but a triangle not a triangle?

      an equilateral triangle is a triangle but a triangle is not necessarily an equilateral triangle, and i think you also made a mistake in your cirle/oval analogy by listing them in the same order twice, and also, i think all your 'not' clauses probably require to say 'not necessarily' to really get at what i think you're trying to say. indeed a rectangle CAN be a square, if the measurements are equal

7.11.23  8:32 am   why do you have one letter off on all of the pages i dont get it

      it's like you know how sometimes logos have designs or pictures, or something stylish.... it's that, but achieved only through text and color, without any images and also without any fonts

7.11.23  6:53 am   bill on 7.29.20 9:24 am you got a question saying " Have you ever got brilliant idea(s) while taking a shower but forgot as soon as you leave the bathroom? It sucks when that happens " and you said you developed some near military grade memory tricks for makign sure that doesent happen please bill what are the tricks 

      here are some memory tricks. pretend you are explaining the idea to someone else, and start explaining it in as many technical ways as you can. Pretend you have to explain it to them so that they can reproduce the idea exactly, but, you are not allowed to actually demonstrate it. For example, if it's a sentence, say "the first word is ___, the second word is ____," etc... Count the words. remind yourself how many words there are. Say all the odd numbered words. Say all the even numbered words. Think of the first letter of each word, and put all those letters together. try to come up with an alternate sentence using the same starting letters. Try to access the idea in as many different ways as you can. If it is a musical idea, start thinking of the notation of it, imagine you are explaining the musical notation to someone else without singing it. List the notes in order. Count the notes. List the rhythmic values in order. If you don't know musical notation in this way, hopefully you have some other conceptual notation system you use to think about notes and time. What tempo is it? what song has a similar tempo? how many notes are in the first beat? how many notes are in the second beat? etc etc etc. Keep trying to access the idea on as many mental avenues as you can, and this will increase the likelyhood that you will be able to retrieve it. However, ...... if you've really just had the idea of a lifetime, and your life depends on it, then you can get out of the shower immediately and go write it down. it's a good feeling to know you have that level of professionalism

7.11.23  5:21 am   do you have a funny gif

      no

7.11.23  1:05 am   what time signature is i want to be a movie star in

      generally the repeating chorus (title lines) are in 9/4 (or, alternating 4/4 and 5/4 if you prefer). the verses seem to almost follow this, but there are exceptions usually at the end of every stanza. and the bridge doesn't follow it either

7.10.23  11:34 pm   any reason that, when doing on screen lyrics, you break them up by word instead of syllables?

      sure. the best reason for me to choose to show the whole word instantly instead of one syllable at a time would be: if i think the single-syllable way would look like crap. Generally i've experimented with a wide range of methods and timings for expressing lyrics on screen, and i'm usually going for what is most potent. timing is essential, so indeed i've tried the single-syllable way, but it almost always looks terrible and actually less potent, probably because we're so used to reading the words the way they are. by a similar token, sometimes in fact single-words is too awkward also, so i sometimes opt for entire phrases. i'm often pretty exhaustive in the amount of ways i try it, in search of the most effective

7.10.23  9:46 pm   please consider looking at the four good news accounts (matthew, mark, luke, john). each of these was written to a different audience, and each of these men have a unique way of delivering the good news of what they saw. if it has the ring of truth, trust in it! you'll never regret it.

      they do indeed ring so. indeed many other voices and stories have such a ring to them as well, and i've found that these rings are by no means limited to the ones found within christianity. for me, the ring actually gets much stronger as i find rings across different cultures, religions, sciences, and contexts

I am a full time musician and multi-instrumentalist, mostly gigging as a jazz pianist, gospel organist, and funk keyboardist in the Detroit area.

I love your music and have a particular appreciation for your songwriting and harmonic sensibilities. I have learned many of your songs.

Do you ever plan to perform your music live with a band?

I would very much like to be in that band.

Regardless, I hope all is well.

7.9.23  10:07 pm   how did you get the fluttery effect in the main melody of "fly around" thats super interesting and unique

      it's like when you flutter on a xylophone with 2 notes. alternate the 2 notes really quick. i'm doing that on one instrument, and then another one is just holding down the notes normally, like a piano would do

7.9.23  9:54 pm   why is recording vocals so much harder than i expected it to be? like, i think i generally sound fine when i sing, and even when i just record myself singing and playing at the keyboard, but the second i sing right into the mic for a song i'm recording, a billion little imperfections make the whole thing sound.... kinda bad. i can do 50 takes and pick word by word what i think sounds good, but that's no fun. any tips?

     recordings are cursed...... or blessed. depending on whether you wanted it to come out good. if you want it to come out good, that will curse any recording. if you don't care whether it comes out good, that will automatically bless a recording

7.9.23  5:56 pm   I came up with a nice melody I really like and I can play it with one hand on the piano, but how do I figure out how to accompany it with both hands?

      try playing it at parties. play it at 10 parties and after the 10th party you'll find something. it might be with your voice. it might be someone else doing it. it might even just be in how you frame the melody in context, based on what you say to people before or after. as soon as you start using this thing for communication, then you'll start seeing what it can do
